title: Maternity Care Problems in England
summary: A report in England says that maternity care is not working well for many families. Baroness Amos is leading a review and found six big problems, including racism and not enough staff. Over 8,000 people shared their stories, and she met more than 400 families. The report shows that care is very mixed: some families get good care, but others have bad experiences. Racism is a big issue, with some women being treated unfairly because of their race or religion. For example, Asian women might be called 'princesses' and Black women might be told they can handle pain better. The Health Secretary promises to make changes based on the final report in June. This is important because everyone deserves safe and kind care when having a baby.

background_read: Maternity care is the help doctors and nurses give to women during pregnancy and when having a baby. In England, a review is being done to check if this care is good enough. Baroness Amos is in charge and found problems like racism, where people are treated unfairly because of their race, and staff shortages, meaning there aren't enough workers. Families have shared their stories, showing that some get excellent care while others have terrible experiences. The government plans to use the report to make things better so all families can have safe and kind care.
